article.headline: Rice 70, Southern Miss 55
article.story: HOUSTON (AP) -- Morris Almond scored 20 of his game-high 35 points in the second half to lead Rice to a 70-55 victory over Southern Mississippi Wednesday night. Almond made 14 of 21 shots from the field, including all four of his 3-pointers, and sank his only three free throws for Rice (12-10, 6-3 Conference USA). Rice led for much of the game, taking the lead for good at 14-12 on an Almond 3-pointer with 10:11 left in the first half. Southern Miss (14-8 overall, 4-5) pulled within two at 38-36 after a Courtney Beasley basket with 14:18 left in the game, but Almond answered with a 3-point play and Lawrence Ghoram followed with dunk as Rice opened a 43-36 lead. The Eagles could get no closer than than five points the remainder of the way. Almond scored eight straight points to give Rice a 51-41 lead. Jeremy Wise and Sai'Quon Stone each scored 17 points to pace Southern Miss. Lorenzo Williams, with 11 points, was the only other Rice player in double figures.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
